results.title: The Bright side
results.creator_credit: Irving Jacoby, Affiliated Film Producers and Mental Health Board
results.brief_description: Shows how parents day-to-day enjoyment of family living provides the best emotional climate for children. An excerpt from a longer film on mental illness, “The Lonely night”, depicts a mentally healthy family, the Dunns, the relaxed and sensible way in which the parents deal with minor problems and discords, and the personal satisfaction of each individual as they share in the responsibilities and pleasures of the family. Reaffirms the intuitive wisdom of parents who themselves have mature and healthy personalities.

results.title: A Visit to the Hsin Hua School in Peking (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Records some of the activities in an elementary school in Beijing from playground games and classes to involvement in a cooperative manufacturing project.
Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: A Brief history of astronomy
results.creator_credit: Manitoba Museum of Man and Nature and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: An animated film tracing humankind’s appreciation of the universe, from the earliest interest in the sun and sky, throughout history to our present knowledge of modern astronomy. Reviews the ideas of great thinkers and philosophers like Ptolemy, Copernicus, Tycho Brahe, Kepler, Galileo and Newtown.

results.title: Brief encounter [study extract]
results.brief_description: An extract from “Brief encounter” directed by David Lean. An ordinary suburban housewife, and a young married doctor, meet casually, fall deeply in love, but realises family ties do not permit their passion so they part. In the extract Laura and Alec spend their last day together before he goes to South Africa. They part where they met - in the station buffet. Their last moments are shattered by the arrival of a talkative friend of Laura’s. In despair she almost commits suicide but reason prevails and she returns to her husband. The extract is dominated by the heavy atmosphere of the railway station, the emotional dialogue and the climax of the suicide attempt.

results.title: Bridging the learning gap
results.creator_credit: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre
results.brief_description: Discusses the use of small discussion groups as the main teaching medium in the University’s Faculty of Law, and reasons for the adoption of the system. The role of the teacher in this teaching situation, and the extent to which objectives are being achieved are being evaluated by the T.E.R.C. Increasing student interest and involvement is apparent.

results.title: Bridging the G.A.P.
results.creator_credit: Robert Rothols and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: A promotional film showing the get-together in Victoria of gold awardees in the Duke of Edinburgh scheme. Depicts the community services carried out by the young people during their stay in Victoria.

results.title: Bridging the centuries
results.creator_credit: John Patterson Reid, Royal Doulton and World Wide
results.brief_description: Traces the history of pottery making in Britain from neolithic times to the present day. Examples of rare English pottery and china from different centuries are shown. Illustrates the influence of Chinese work on the development of English bone china. Describes the evolution of English translucent china particularly for tableware.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Patterson Reid, Royal Doulton and World Wide

results.title: Bridges in Holland
results.creator_credit: Rolf Orthel, Bert Haanstra and Bert Haanstra Film Productions
results.brief_description: A tribute to Holland’s bridge builders; a beautifully photographed study of the texture and structure of bridges to present a view of Holland in all seasons in all parts. The assembly of shots of bridges from opening ceremonies to demolition tell their own story without commentary. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Bridge to space
results.creator_credit: Robert Gaffney, Charles R. Trieschman, National Aeronautics and Space Administration and Seneca Productions
results.brief_description: A bus tour visits the Cape Kennedy Moonport of Project Apollo, recording the impressive sights of the Moonport, of Project A, the Saturn Rockets, the launching pads and control facilities. The tour conductor gives details of the sights.

results.title: Bride and groom
results.brief_description: An experiment in animation technique produced by a group of amateur film makers, about a newly wed couple who cannot get rid of a door-to-door salesman. Pixillated technique is used in which the principles of animation are applied to real people rather than inanimate materials such as drawings and three-dimensional puppets.
